Fields.Name: Type
Fields.ToolTip:
'Needs Chart' are the important pillar of light salvage points that won't appear until you have the relevant Treasure Chart or Triforce Chart.
'Checks Switch' only appear once a certain switch is set, such as Big Octo salvage points.
'Normal Light Ring' are light rings that always appear.
'Night Only' are light rings that only appear at night.
'Octorok Vase' are invisible salvage points that will cause the player to fish up an old vase, and then spawn a Saltwater Octorok next to them.
'Full Moon Night Only' are light rings that only appear at night when the full moon is out.

Fields.Name: Chart
Fields.ToolTip:
Affects which chart reveals this salvage point.
Only works for 'Needs Chart' type salvage points.

Fields.Name: Salvage Flag
Fields.ToolTip:
Which salvage flag in this sector to use for this salvage point. Can be from 0-15.
Or set this to 31 if you want the salvage point to reappear every time the player exits and re-enters the sector.
Only works for 'Checks Switch', 'Normal Light Ring', and 'Night Only' type salvage points.

Fields.Name: Salvaged Event Bit
Fields.ToolTip:
This event bit will be set when the player salvages it, and the salvage point will not appear as long as it's set.
All sixteen of these are cleared once per ingame week, on Friday.
Only works for 'Full Moon Night Only' type salvage points.

Fields.Name: Duplicate Placement ID
Fields.ToolTip:
When placing a salvage point that needs a chart to see, you should actually place 4 in the same sector in different placements, with the only difference being that this ID should be 0, 1, 2, or 3, one for each.
When the player starts a new save file, the game will randomly pick one of these different placements from 0-2, and only that placement of chart salvages will appear on that save file.
In Second Quest, only the ones with placement ID 3 will appear.
Only works for 'Needs Chart' type salvage points.

Fields.Name: Switch to Check
Fields.ToolTip:
The salvage point will not appear until this switch is set.
Only works for 'Checks Switch' type salvage points.
